1:
How lovely is the place where you live,\q Yahweh of hosts!
\q
2:
I long for the courts of Yahweh, my desire for it has made me exhausted.\q My heart and all of my being call out to the living God.


\q
3:
Even the sparrow has found her a house\q and the swallow a nest for herself where she may lay her young
\q near your altars, Yahweh of hosts,
\q my King, and my God.
\q
4:
Blessed are they who live in your house;\q they praise you continually.
\qs Selah\qs*


\q
5:
Blessed is the man whose strength is in you,\q in whose heart are the highways up to Zion.
\q
6:
Passing through the Valley of Tears, they find springs of water to drink.\q The early rains cover it with blessings.
\f + \ft Some versions have \fqa with pools of water \fqa* . \f*


\q
7:
They go from strength to strength;\q every one of them appears before God in Zion.
\q
8:
Yahweh God of hosts, hear my prayer;\q God of Jacob, listen to what I am saying!
\qs Selah\qs*
\q
9:
God, watch over our shield;\q show concern for your anointed.
\q
10:
For one day in your courts is better than a thousand elsewhere.\q I would rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God,
\q than to live within the tents of the wicked.


\q
12: Yahweh of hosts,\q blessed is the man who trusts in you.
